Package com.example.backend.controller

Class FlightController

java.lang.Object
com.example.backend.controller.FlightController
@CrossOrigin(origins={"http://localhost:3000","http://localhost:5173"}) @RestController @RequestMapping(path="/flight") public class FlightController extends Object
The FlightController class serves as the controller for handling all HTTP requests involving Flight objects. This class utilizes the FlightService for performing database operations and returning data to the client. It handles CORS requests from specified local addresses. The class is marked with the @Slf4j annotation which provides logging through the logback library. Authentication is additionally secured by the @AdditionalAuthentication annotation.

  • Constructor Details

    • FlightController

      @Autowired public FlightController(FlightService flightService)
      The FlightController constructor which is autowired by Spring (via the @Autowired annotation) to provide an instance of FlightService.
      Parameters:
      flightService - The service that handles operations related to Flight objects.

  • Method Details

    • getAllFlights

      @GetMapping public Collection<Flight> getAllFlights()
      The getAllFlights method returns a collection of all Flight objects. The method is mapped to GET requests at "/flight".
      Returns:
      A collection of all Flight objects.

    • getFlightsByIds

      @PostMapping(path="/flights_by_ids") public Collection<Flight> getFlightsByIds(@RequestBody Map<String,Object> requestBody)
      The getFlightsByIds method returns a collection of Flight objects based on a list of flight IDs. The method is mapped to POST requests at "/flight/flights_by_ids". The @AdditionalAuthentication annotation requires an additional level of authentication to access this method.
      Parameters:
      requestBody - The request body containing a list of flight IDs.
      Returns:
      A collection of Flight objects.

    • findFlightsByCity

      @GetMapping("/find") public Collection<Flight> findFlightsByCity(@RequestParam("city_from") String cityFrom, @RequestParam("city_to") String cityTo)
      The findFlightsByCity method returns a collection of Flight objects based on departure and arrival cities. The method is mapped to GET requests at "/flight/find".
      Parameters:
      cityFrom - The departure city.
      cityTo - The arrival city.
      Returns:
      A collection of Flight objects.
